repository.description: Git with a cup of tea! Painless self-hosted all-in-one software development service, including Git hosting, code review, team collaboration, package registry and CI/CD

issue.body: # Summary Empty dividers are shown with no enclosed labels when the archived labels are hidden from list # Before fix The dividers will show on the list even if the enclosed labels are hidden # After the fix The divider has been conditionally hidden when the label is not shown in the list - With archived labels hidden - With archived labels shown Fixed #27466

body:
The issue is due to the divider being rendered unconditionally

This has been fixed as part of #27668

I think the easiest approach to completely fix the problem is by refactoring the code completely.
As far as I know, @puni9869 is already working on sorting archived labels to the bottom of the search results, which will fix this problem as well and it will be much less error-prone.

> The issue is due to the divider being rendered unconditionally
> 
> This has been fixed as part of #27668

This is known issue.

issue.body: as title regression #27466 After changes:

body: Does the problem still exist in 1.23?

> Does the problem still exist in 1.23?

It does
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6b9d8338-4660-4f47-873b-392487fc1d1d)

Gitea 6bd70d4d87262e3bf423aa8a598cfdcf3aae4008
The problem is that `tw-hidden` doesn't work with the dropdown divider. It can't be fixed by template patches.

> The problem is that `tw-hidden` doesn't work with the dropdown divider. It can't be fixed by template patches.

I don't know how labels work currently, but I'd imagine backend would for a merged list of labels aka. map[map[int64, string]] and frontend would just print that nested grouped map. With this logic, but would never happen

> > The problem is that `tw-hidden` doesn't work with the dropdown divider. It can't be fixed by template patches.
> 
> I don't know how labels work currently, but I'd imagine backend would for a merged list of labels aka. map[map[int64, string]] and frontend would just print that nested grouped map. With this logic, but would never happen

It's not that easy. Frontend dropdown needs to "filter" the list. So it also needs to handle such case:

```
item1
divider
item2 (not matched the input and will be hidden by frontend)
divider (this will also be hidden)
item3
```

Actually the dropdown could already handles such case, but it is unable to mix these 2 different usages if item2 is hidden by other methods but not by the filter.

> if item2 is hidden by other methods

Shouldn't those items that are hidden by other methods be non-existent for dropdown? Where am I missing?

> > if item2 is hidden by other methods
> 
> Shouldn't those items that are hidden by other methods be non-existent for dropdown? Where am I missing?

* Hidden by "archive": `class="tw-hidden"`
* Hidden by "filter": `class="filtered"`
* And `filtered` can't be used by "Hidden by 'archive'" (anther long story, you could take a try to see what would happen)

repository.description: Git with a cup of tea! Painless self-hosted all-in-one software development service, including Git hosting, code review, team collaboration, package registry and CI/CD

issue.body:
Fix #27466

The problem is that any item in the menu could be hidden, pure CSS won't work, and dropdown's builtin "hideDividers" doesn't work with our "scope dividers". The newly introduced "archived" label makes the dividers regression more.

Before (duplicate / incorrect dividers):

<details>

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e6ddc8bf-cac2-427d-a722-ce72c836cdc5)

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1433654e-741a-4240-a7e0-efc2af36223b)

</details>

After:

<details>

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e70dd59b-a603-4744-b2d5-b31319fdb207)

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/efd827f0-be26-4114-a875-ddbe16b451b5)

</details>

By the way, the lint rule `unicorn/consistent-function-scoping` doesn't help really our code and might force to do unnecessary code moving during refactoring, so disable it (and then a `eslint-disable-line` could be removed)

body:
No, it won't work.

See this:  Fix duplicate dropdown dividers #32760

> No, it won't work.
> 
> See this: Fix duplicate dropdown dividers #32760

But it does, see screenshots https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/pull/32758
@stuzer05 Thanks for the taking this forward. Now a days I am packed up. This was in my todo list from last year. But unfortunately I could not able to fix it.
